title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake Seems Popular At The Tokyo Game Show
text:
Photo: All photos: Brian Ashcraft

In what should surprise absolutely no one, Final Fantasy VII Remake is drawing long lines at the Tokyo Game Show. I think people in Japan might be excited about this game. Call it a hunch!

Today is the first public date for the 2019 Tokyo Game Show. As soon as the general public started being let in, many attendees started to make a beeline to either the Sony booth or the Square Enix to play the upcoming FFVII Remake.

At around 9.40am, the end of the line at the Square Enix booth looked like this:

Sony had cut off the FFVII Remake line by 10am, along with several other titles. The red stickers say that the demo sessions have ended for the day.

10am at the Sony booth @ the Tokyo Game Show pic.twitter.com/PPuUJyRhBQ — Brian Ashcraft (@Brian_Ashcraft) September 14, 2019

Square Enix, which had a significantly larger FFVII Remake set up with more demo stations, didn’t cut off the line until to sometime around 10.10am or around thereafter.

At around 10:20am, Square Enix booth @ the Tokyo Game Show. FF7 Remake line closed for the day about ten minutes earlier. pic.twitter.com/UoRFDtdbhw — Brian Ashcraft (@Brian_Ashcraft) September 14, 2019

Even the wait to take photos with Cloud’s Hardy-Daytona motorcycle is long. Square Enix passing out tickets for folks to come back later so they don’t have to stand in line for extended periods of time.

This is me going out on a limb, but I think people in Japan are excited about FFVII Remake.
description: In what should surprise absolutely no one, Final Fantasy VII Remake is drawing long lines at the Tokyo Game Show. I think people in Japan might be excited about this game. Call it a hunch!...
